summary:
Arya: I have no parental figure telling me not to wrestle bears.

Jon, quickly: It's me. I am that figure. I am telling you now,...
body:
Arya: I have no parental figure telling me not to wrestle bears.

Jon, quickly: It’s me. I am that figure. I am telling you now, do not wrestle bears.

blog.name: gameofthronestldr
blog.title: Game of Thrones;tldr
blog.description: I love Game of Thrones, both the books and the HBO series. I would like to explore characters, places, etc. in a shortened as possible way (hence the tldr). This will include both information from the books and show.

tags: a song of ice and fire
title: Jon Snow
body:
“How do I play the turncloak without becoming a one?” - Jon Snow

Born: 283 AC at the Tower of Joy

Died: 300 AC at Castle Black (later resurrected)

Hair: Dark Brown

Eye Color: Grey

Features: Lean build and long face of a Stark

Culture: Northmen

Father: 

  1. Biological: Rhaegar Targaryen
  2. Adoptive: Eddard Stark

Mother: Lyanna Stark

Siblings:

  • Paternal half-siblings:
    • Rhaenys Targaryen
    • Aegon Targaryen
  • Maternal cousins raised as half-siblings:
    • Robb Stark
    • Sansa Stark
    • Arya Stark
    • Bran Stark
    • Rickon Stark

Titles:

  1. Warden of the North
  2. King in the North
  3. 998th Lord Commander of the Night’s Watch

Aliases: 

  1. Aegon Targaryen
  2. Lord Snow
  3. The Bastard of Winterfell
  4. King Crow
  5. The Prince That Was Promised
  6. The White Wolf 

Allegiance:

  1. House Stark
  2. House Targaryen
  3. The Night’s Watch

Religion: Old Gods of the Forest

Direwolf: Ghost

History

Jon Snow, born Aegon Targaryen, is the son of Lyanna Stark and Rhaegar Targaryen, the late Prince of Dragonstone. He was born during Robert’s Rebellion. From infancy, Jon is presented as the bastard son of Lord Eddard Stark, Lyanna’s brother, and raised by Eddard alongside his lawful children at Winterfell but his true parentage is kept secret from everyone, including Jon himself. In order to escape his bastard status, Jon joins the Night’s Watch at 14 years old and is eventually chosen as Lord Commander. However, he is later murdered in a mutiny and resurrected by the Red Priestess Melisandre. Freed from his Night’s Watch vows, Jon joins his cousin, Sansa Stark, in building an army and together they retake Winterfell from House Bolton, restoring House Stark’s dominion over the North with Jon being declared the new King in the North. However, after successfully capturing a wight and presenting it to the Lannisters as proof that the Army of the Dead is real, Jon pledges himself and his army to Daenerys Targaryen, Rhaegar’s sister, and steps down as King of the North.

Appearance and Personality

Jon is said to have more of the north in him and resembles his father Eddard more than his half-brothers, who have inherited Tully features from Catelyn. Even at age 14, Jon is lean with dark brown hair and grey eyes so dark they border on black. Many people are able to identify Jon is of Stark blood just by looking at him.

Jon was raised by his father Eddard Stark alongside his brothers and sisters to know the ways of honor and duty, and possesses a strong moral compass.

Skills

Jon is proven to be highly skilled in combat, especially with a sword. He is a natural leader, which he proves early on in his time at the Night’s Watch.

Relationships

Ygritte: She was Jon’s first love, although in their first encounter she tries to seduce and cheat him. When Jon infiltrates the Wildlings, they become lovers and Jon really falls in love with her, but ultimately he choses his vows for the Night’s Watch over her. Ygritte shoots him with three arrows but her feelings couldn’t bring herself to kill him. In the Battle of Castle Black, Ygritte was killed by Olly and died in the Jon’s arms, her body was cremated by a devastated Jon.

Daenerys Targaryen: The Mad King’s daughter and the youngest sister of Jon’s father, Prince Rhaegar, making her his aunt by blood. Having been summoned from Winterfell to bend the knee to Daenerys, Jon initially refuses on the grounds that they need to ally against the Night King and the army of the dead instead of removing Cersei from the Iron Throne.

tags: the real jon snow defense squad
summary: Basically what “Jon snow fan” think he is on season 7, he is stupid and honorable so he won’t lie to cersei and to dany, and...
caption:
Basically what “Jon snow fan” think he is on season 7, he is stupid and honorable so he won’t lie to cersei and to dany, and he’s having sex with dany because he can’t control himself because he’s sooooooo in love with dany.

Bich, he already did that in season 6 (and 5) and it almost cost him his life! (it did cost him his life in season 5) Do you really want him to be stupid and honorable again? You want him to make a mistake like Ned and Robb?

Do you want a dead Jon snow? Because that’s how you get a dead Jon snow!

blog.name: reddragon1995
blog.title: Jonerys Snowstorm Of House Stargaryen
blog.description: HE LOVED HER AND SHE LOVED HIM

summary:
I give more thought than I should to what baby Jonerys will be named. I think it’s obvious, if it’s a boy:
AEMON.
Think about...
body:
I give more thought than I should to what baby Jonerys will be named. I think it’s obvious, if it’s a boy:

AEMON.

Think about it. Maester Aemon is the only other Targaryen Jon has ever met, and I believe had as much a role in shaping Jon to be the leader he has become as anyone did. He’s one of the good guys. He cast the deciding vote that elected Jon Lord Commander. He’s so boss, he died of old age. In Westeros. Like Jon, he didn’t want to be king, only he had the option to refuse.

Viserys and Rhaegar have dragons named for them. I suppose Jon and Dany could choose a “Northern” name: perhaps Eddard (too easy) or even Robb. I personally think Jon and Dany will have plenty of opportunity to name children, and give them Targaryen and Northern names. But this baby bean is gonna be an Aemon.

I personally think Jon and Dany will have plenty of opportunity to name children, and give them Targaryen and Northern names. But this baby bean is gonna be an Aemon.
trail.content:
I give more thought than I should to what baby Jonerys will be named. I think it’s obvious, if it’s a boy:

AEMON.

Think about it. Maester Aemon is the only other Targaryen Jon has ever met, and I believe had as much a role in shaping Jon to be the leader he has become as anyone did. He’s one of the good guys. He cast the deciding vote that elected Jon Lord Commander. He’s so boss, he died of old age. In Westeros. Like Jon, he didn’t want to be king, only he had the option to refuse.

Viserys and Rhaegar have dragons named for them. I suppose Jon and Dany could choose a “Northern” name: perhaps Eddard (too easy) or even Robb. I personally think Jon and Dany will have plenty of opportunity to name children, and give them Targaryen and Northern names. But this baby bean is gonna be an Aemon.

summary: Aegon's Brightfyre theory is an interesting theory but do not you think Aegon to not be in the chosen branch is rather bad for...
question: Aegon's Brightfyre theory is an interesting theory but do not you think Aegon to not be in the chosen branch is rather bad for the narrative ? His failure would be justified because he was not from the chosen branch and this would imply Jon or Daenerys will only because they are.
answer:
I disagree as to what the implications would be. Ultimately, Aegon’s not going to fail because his bloodline isn’t special enough, he’s going to fail because he hasn’t been tested and tried as Daenerys has. When the going gets tough, Dany will be in her element…and Aegon will not.

Dany’s own position as one of the heroes of the story, in turn, was not given to her because her bloodline is special - not for nothing do we hear of the longstanding and unsuccessful Targaryen dragon-hatching project - but because she was willing to step into the fire herself, and because she’s blazed her own trail not relying on what others were willing to give her because of her surname. She did not rely on Drogo or Illyrio or Xaro Xhoan Daxos or Viserys or Jorah. She did not even rely on her dragons - she is their mother, the only one with power over them. She fought and sacrificed for what she has. Herself.

Over in Jon’s storyline, meanwhile, I doubt that anything comes as close to destroying Jon and preventing him from chipping in to save the world as the revelation of his biological parentage. Jon’s love for his father and his siblings is one of his major motivations. I expect that discovering that in terms of biology they’re his uncle and his cousins, discovering that he was bred for destiny like goddamned cattle, will be profoundly alienating for Jon. The sort of thing that almost has him throw in the towel. Reconnecting with his identity as Jon Snow, Ned Stark’s son, brother to Robb, Sansa, Arya, Bran and Rickon, however - that can get him to fight for humanity at large. The Targaryen heritage is a detriment to him rather than an advantage; the qualities that make him heroic were instilled by his family life at Winterfell and his own experiences thereafter.

summary: A Year Of Thrones: Game of Thrones Season 5
title: A Year Of Thrones: Game of Thrones Season 5
body:
A Year Of Thrones: Game of Thrones Season 5

This year I resolved to read George R. R. Martin‘s A Song of Ice and Fire and watch HBO’s Game of Thrones, both series. For all of you who have seen the entire series and/or read all the books, here is your chance to experience it for the first time all over again!

Why I Chose it:I had tried watching the series a few times and only ever reached the half-way point of the first season. Then I was…

View On WordPress
